content: Known for his theory of evolution, which English naturalist traveled aboard the HMS Beagle on a five-year voyage around the world?

Charles Darwin was the English naturalist who is famous for his theory of evolution. He embarked on a five-year voyage around the world aboard the HMS Beagle from 1831 to 1836. This journey played a crucial role in shaping his ideas about species adaptation and natural selection, which he later detailed in his groundbreaking book, "On the Origin of Species."
